title: Variables
summary: Variables store values so you can reuse or modify them later. They have a name and a value, and the value can change over time.
sample_question: What is a variable and why is it useful?
options: Option A A named storage for a value
Option B A function that prints text
Option C A loop that repeats steps

title: Loops
summary: Loops let you repeat an action multiple times until a condition is met. Common types are for loops and while loops.
sample_question: Explain the difference between a for loop and a while loop.
options: Option A A way to repeat actions
Option C A comment for documentation

title: Conditionals
summary: Conditionals run code only when a condition is true or false.
sample_question: What is an if statement used for?
options: Option A Run code based on a condition
Option B Repeat actions a fixed number of times
Option C Store values with names

title: Functions
summary: Functions group reusable code into a named block.
options: Option A Reuse and organize code

title: Lists
summary: Lists hold ordered collections of items.
sample_question: What is a list and when to use it?
options: Option A Store multiple values in order

title: Constants
summary: Constants are values that shouldn't change.
